image.altText: Two dolphins leaping out of the water

props.synopsis: Inside one of the world's only city-based dolphin sanctuary, the pod population has halved since becoming protected and experts fear some of their biggest challenges are ahead.

title.children: Going beneath the surface to protect dolphins

image.altText: A smiling large man in black jacket, light pants next to smiling, older, trim man holds a hose, next to grey holden.

props.synopsis: Malcom Harris had only just learnt CPR when he used it to save a man's life in the 1980s. Four decades later, during a routine trip to the car wash, the 94-year-old retiree was the one who needed saving.

title.children: Fisherman uses 30 years of CPR training to save life at car wash

image.altText: A group of Adelaide Crows and Port Adelaide AFL players run through a single banner - it reads "Vale Phil Walsh 1960-2015".

props.synopsis: The tragic death of Crows coach Phil Walsh stunned the football world and united the two halves of Adelaide — two weeks later, Adelaide met Port Adelaide in a game like no other. On the 10th anniversary, Andrew McGarry looks back at Showdown 39.

title.children: 'Never experienced anything like it': A decade on from the Phil Walsh Showdown

image.altText: Two people looking at the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: The siblings who discovered the body of Rosemary Brown 25 years ago have spoken for the first time, as police renew the search for her missing daughter Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Children linked to 25-year cold case speak for the first time

image.altText: A garfish laying flat on the seafloor

props.synopsis: South Australia's primary industries minister has written to her federal counterpart about "industry support" for fishers impacted by the ongoing algal bloom.

title.children: SA government calls for federal help for local industries as algal bloom continues

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man alleged to have made repeated violent threats against Glenunga International High School has been released on bail by South Australia's Supreme Court.

title.children: Teen released on bail following alleged violent school threats

image.altText: A veteran SANFL footballer runs out on an oval with a football under his arm, as fans cheer and hold red and white balloons.

props.synopsis: Silky skills, versatility and an ability to make other players "look foolish without even looking" — Barrie Robran had it all, according to those who played football with him.

title.children: Why SA football legend Barrie Robran was one of the greats

image.altText: A small mouse peeps out between a person's fingers.

props.synopsis: Conservationists have offered surprising insights into what small mammal colonies may have looked like before Europeans arrived in Australia.

title.children: 27-year study of outback reserve offers glimpse into pre-colonial times

image.altText: Two women with arms on their hips in a large hall, some dancers hang around a stage

props.synopsis: Three of Ukraine's most celebrated dancers have travelled from war-torn Kyiv to Australia to conduct a week-long traditional dance masterclass.

title.children: Honoured Ukrainian dancers 'pass legacy on' as war continues

image.altText: A man wearing shorts, tshirt and sneakers and a backpack stands on a sandy track with ocean in the background

props.synopsis: Three months after former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs was convicted and fined over drug supply charges, he has detailed his plans to hike the Kokoda Track on a "personal journey of restoration and renewal".

title.children: David Speirs's mind went to 'dark and scary places' ahead of Kokoda hike

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: A charge has been dropped against neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell over a march through the Adelaide CBD on Australia Day.

title.children: Loitering charge dropped against neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell over Australia Day march

image.altText: GettyImages-2225957486

props.synopsis: Steven May will face tribunal scrutiny after leaving Francis Evans bloodied in a contest, as Maurice Rioli lights up Perth with his defensive work. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Demons star faces scrutiny after Blues forward left bloodied in clash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Liam Ryan has kicked a GOTY contender!
Steven May has flattened Francis Evans

image.altText: Sione Tuipulotu celebrates

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions lead the Wallabies, who hit back through an excellent try before half time in a ferocious Test match in Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: Wallabies fall to defeat in opening Test as Lions power to victory

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Five quick hits from the first Test
FULL-TIME: British and Irish Lions 27 def Wallabies 19
79' TRY: Tate McDermott scores for the Wallabies

image.altText: John Norman in a cotton field holding a cotton plant, date unknown.

props.synopsis: In an industry brimming with rumours of dodgy operators, cotton grower John Norman was staking his claim as an honest broker. But while being publicly celebrated as a farming success story, he was secretly defrauding the taxpayer.

title.children: The rise and fall of John Norman, the respected farmer who became a fraudster

image.altText: Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel, both wearing dark suits, shake hands and smile on the set of a late night show

props.synopsis: Late-night talk show hosts rally around Stephen Colbert following the announcement that his show won't return after 2026, with US President Donald Trump writing on social media: "Kimmel is next."

title.children: 'Kimmel is next': Trump reacts to Colbert cancellation, hosts rally around star

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese, looking slightly stern as he talks.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese describes recent actions in Gaza as "completely indefensible" and says he told Israeli President Isaac Herzog directly that Israel was losing support by its own actions.

title.children: 'Completely indefensible': PM signals toughened stance on Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Astronomer says the company has launched an investigation but did not explicitly mention the Coldplay concert moment.

title.children: Tech CEO Andy Byron 'placed on leave' amid Coldplay concert saga

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Chengdu (for Laura Tingle column pls don't use)

props.synopsis: The visit was a textbook case of China trying to portray itself as the steady and calm adult in the global room.

title.children: Anthony Albanese isn't doing diplomacy with China by halves

image.altText: JAPAN TRUMP

props.synopsis: The amount of leverage or borrowing tied to bonds at present is inching closer to what we saw prior to the global financial crisis.

title.children: Australia's $4 trillion super sector exposed to 'devastating' bond market run

image.altText: theatre

props.synopsis: The UK has sanctioned Russian military intelligence officers linked to the 2022 Mariupol theatre bomb attack that killed hundreds of civilians.

title.children: Russian officers sanctioned over bomb attack that killed up to 300

image.altText: Mr Skaik sitting on an upright piano in Preston Markets smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Five months after fleeing his home in Gaza, Baher Skaik sat behind a piano in Melbourne's Preston Markets. He was there to play for strangers as part of the ABC series The Piano. It brought unexpected and life-changing rewards for his young family.

title.children: Baher moved a market to tears and sealed a new future for his family

image.altText: A man with a mullet and a white singlet top

props.synopsis: From start to finish the Lachlan Young trial for the alleged murder of Hannah McGuire was riddled with twists and turns. A look back on a turbulent eight days in court.

title.children: The courtroom drama of Lachlan Young's murder trial

image.altText: Photo of building taken from ground looking up. Top floor is covered in fire, blazing, bright orange. Night time.

props.synopsis: One person has died in a mass Russian drone attack on Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odesa, which set ablaze a multi-storey apartment building.

title.children: One dead in Russian drone attack on Ukrainian port city Odesa

image.altText: Children running onto the beach

props.synopsis: DPR Korea Tour, a website operated by North Korea's tourism authority, says the Wonsan-Kalma coastal resort is "temporarily not receiving foreign tourists".

title.children: North Korea bans foreign tourists to newly opened beach resort

image.altText: East Antarctica

props.synopsis: Scientists aim to unlock insights into the Earth's climate evolution after recovering ice core in Antarctica.

title.children: World's oldest ice could unlock 'completely unknown' climate history

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt holds a Druze flag in his left hand as he looks into the camera under a dark night sky.

props.synopsis: When the Israel-Syria border was breached, heartwarming family reunions decades in the making ensued for a number of hours, on both sides of the fence. But the happiness was still tempered by fear over the conflict.

title.children: This gate had been off limits for decades, then Israel seized an opportunity

image.altText: Skiers stand next to a sign in the snow.

props.synopsis: Visits to Aussie ski resorts dropped by nearly 30 per cent since the pandemic with the expense putting it out of reach for many. But here's some tips on how to do it without breaking the bank.

title.children: Is skiing overseas really cheaper? The Japan vs Aussie alps showdown

image.altText: Paige Bueckers dribbles the basketball with her right hand

props.synopsis: The pay dispute between the WNBA and its players continues to be the elephant in the room as the league celebrates its All-Star weekend.

title.children: Star rookie lashes 'disrespectful' WNBA proposal amid bitter pay dispute

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, centre, celebrates his election win with his partner Jodie Haydon (R) and Labor senate leader Penny Wong (L).

props.synopsis: The public service briefs prepared for ministers in the returned Albanese government are heavily redacted, but still offer some interesting insights into the challenges it faces.

title.children: 'Difficult few years': What the public service just told its new ministers

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Mark Carney shake hands.

props.synopsis: When Canada and Australia experienced similar election results, the impact of the Trump effect became clearer, along with its potential to shift future alliances.

title.children: The 'Trump effect' could mean an alliance shift that excludes the US

image.altText: a man in hoodie on computer as woman walks past.

props.synopsis: South Korea's new government faces pressure from both sides: young women demanding systemic reform, and disaffected young men resentful over perceived "reverse discrimination," expressing growing resentment over issues like military service and job insecurity.

title.children: Deepfake porn and pay gaps: South Korean women have had enough

image.altText: Luke Plapp reacts after crossing the finish line

props.synopsis: Australia's Luke Plapp briefly leads the gruelling 10.9km uphill slog at the Tour de France before becoming one of several challengers to be eclipsed by the prolific Tadej Pogačar.

title.children: Aussie's brilliant climb eclipsed as Pogačar continues Tour dominance

image.altText: A woman in a black one piece swim suit sits beside a pool block and smiles.

props.synopsis: In the last 12 months, teen Ellie Cole has competed at an Olympics and a World Cup, and won a national title. She's now at the World Championships, and tells us the biggest thing she's learnt so far.

title.children: Diver Ellie Cole on impostor syndrome and chasing the perfect ten
